; 外交部周四宣布，国家主席习近平将出席周六在浙江省杭州市举行的第十九届亚运会开幕式。

;

;预计这次聚会将为促进全民健身创造更多机会，让国际社会更好地了解中国，增强国家体育竞争力。

;

; 习近平还将举行欢迎宴会和双边活动外交部表示，周五至周六，为来访的柬埔寨、叙利亚、科威特、尼泊尔、东帝汶、韩国和马来西亚的外国领导人提供了服务。

;

; 总统亲自参加即将举行的杭州亚运会分析人士表示，奥运会以及去年的北京冬奥会和今年夏天的成都大运会，代表了他将中国建设为体育强国的愿景的关键部分。

;

; 王晓赞，上海华东师范大学体育与健康学院教授表示，在不到两年的时间里举办了三项大型体育赛事，极大地丰富了中国在这方面的经验。王说，它改善了体育基础设施，激发了公众的健身热情。

;

;她表示，这些活动将帮助年轻一代培养高水平的体育精神。

; < p>;“最重要的是，这将培养我国的体育人口，这是我国建设体育强国的关键。”

;

; 例如，2022 年北京冬奥会推动了全国范围内让 3 亿人参与冬季运动的努力，这是习近平在全球体育赛事申办阶段提出的一项倡议。< /p>;

; 国际奥委会主席托马斯·巴赫2017年习近平访问瑞士洛桑国际奥委会总部时表示，中国国家主席对体育事业有着清晰的愿景。福建省厦门市集美大学体育产业与治理学教授郑志强强调了习近平作为一名体育狂热爱好者的强调习近平在2014年接受采访时表示，他喜欢游泳、登山，是足球、排球、篮球、网球的爱好者。< /p>;

; 郑说，习近平对体育的兴趣和亲身参与，让他对体育在社会发展中的作用有了更深刻的认识。

;

; 在国家主席的强调下，他表示，全民健身已成为国家战略，体育强国已成为中国梦的重要组成部分。

;

;同时，十年来，中国和体育事业取得了长足进步。 #39;体育发展，中国队在夏季奥运会和冬季奥运会以及其他全球重大赛事中取得重大突破。

;

;此外，王说，公众对体育的参与达到了新的高度。华东师范大学教授。

;

; “全国社区体育场地的可达性显着改善，体育教育在学校课程中的作用更加重要。”

;

;对于中国国家主席来说，体育也是同各国加强联系的重要渠道和联系当地民众的桥梁。

;

;习近平上个月致美中青年学生交流协会和美国华盛顿州友人的信中写道，体育是“增进各国人民友谊的纽带”。

;

; 多年来，习近平参观了英超曼城足球俱乐部青训营，与曼城队时任明星前锋阿奎罗合影留念，并与俄罗斯总统普京在天津共同观看了中俄冰球友谊赛。

;

; 2017年，他还与时任总理默克尔在柏林观看了中德青年队的友谊赛，并获得了阿根廷国家足球队的10号球衣。足球巨星莱昂内尔·梅西2014年访问南美期间。

;徐满山，61岁，半辈子都在工作水利，生长在风景如画的东洲岛，位于浙江省杭州市富春江畔。

;

; 该岛曾经是江中的一个孤立的小点，只有少数人可以到达的渡口。由于交通不便，经济陷入困境。

;

; “当年，岛上家家户户都以务农为生，但要获得粮食、化肥等生活必需品，都需要乘坐小船长途跋涉。”木船，”徐说。 “人们白天出门前先听公鸡的叫声，晚上则依靠灯笼指引回家。真是麻烦。”

;

; 1976年，居民们决定在岛的两端修建两座水坝，将岛与河岸连接起来。

;

; “各位，妇女和儿童积极参与修建水坝。当时我正在上初中，一放学我就赶紧参加劳动力大军。我们肩上扛着大石头，然后把它们扔进河里。”徐说。

;

; 这些水坝通过利用富春江部分支流，封闭了近133公顷的内湖，使岛民能够开始养鱼、改造低洼地区并提高粮食产量。岛上的经济开始复苏。

;

; 修建水坝引发了徐对水利的兴趣，并进一步开发了他的家乡。

;

; 1979年，他进入大学，学的是水利，但随着时间的推移，大坝的影响逐渐显现。

;

; 首先，大坝拦住了支流北至河的水流，导致水只从南方流过。

;

; 二是生态影响明显，下游7.5公里河段形成积水，淤积恶化。

;

; 随着北至河南岸即将建设的富阳水上运动中心，在即将到来的亚运会期间举办赛艇、皮划艇等水上运动项目，杭州市政府启动了一项修复工程。河上的项目通过拆除大坝和修建水闸来解决这些问题。徐被选为该项目的负责人。

;

; 亚运会定于周六晚上在杭州开幕。

;

; “通过拆除上下游水坝并改造”死水'进入“活水”，除了疏浚12公里河道外，我们还恢复了航道的防洪能力。我们还在上下游安装了水闸、水闸，显着提高了河流的自净和通航能力。”

;

; 逐渐恢复生态活力的东洲岛，为亚运会提供了至关重要的支撑。

;

; “我童年最快乐的记忆就是在河里游泳，抓鱼和虾，寻找蛤蜊。项目完成后，我感觉童年时的东洲岛又回来了，原始的风景和宁静的海水。”徐说。

;

; 杭州亚运会的筹办不仅改变了徐的家乡，也改善了城市和周边乡村的环境。此外，还承诺“走向绿色”。

;

; ;可持续场馆;

;

; 富阳水上运动中心屋顶面积约24,000平方米场地被土壤覆盖，并点缀着各种植物，与周围的自然景观无缝融合。

;

; 场馆绿化率达45%，具有固碳、释氧、隔热的作用，同时减少雨水径流。碳封存是一种自然或人工过程，将二氧化碳从大气中去除并以固体或液体形式保存

;

; 在场馆的砾石花园区域下，地下系统回收雨水。雨水经过砾石和渗透性织物过滤后，用于中庭展示、喷泉和灌溉。该系统每月可节水约1000吨。

;

; 杭州亚运会56个场馆中，只有12个是新建的。

;

; 其中，绍兴棒垒球馆浙江绍兴体育中心是最大的体育中心，可容纳10,000个座位。其设计融合了绍兴纺织遗产、传统船只和书法等元素。

;

;场馆内部公共空间与周边社区巧妙融合，形成有机联系。

;

; 场馆内部公共空间与周边社区巧妙融合，形成有机联系。 p>;

; 除赛区外，还设有酒店、社区健身中心和商业区，满足赛后多样化运营需求。

;

; 绍兴市宣传官陈跃伟，

;

; 此外，绍兴市政府正在推动在绍兴建立国家级棒垒球青少年训练中心。

; <与此同时，绍兴柯桥阳山运动攀岩中心曾经是一个废弃矿井所在地。建设开发工作已将其打造成国际比赛场馆和青少年运动攀岩基地。中心呈蚕茧状，采用半开放式设计，运动员和观众可以欣赏阳山风景区的景色。

;

; 其余44个比赛场馆均已改造或临时搭建，重点是采用装配式建筑技术以及使用可持续和可再生材料。

;

;例如，杭州奥体中心国博壁球馆的玻璃墙和观众席等设施都可以拆除，场馆维护服务总监周聪聪表示，“我们将向亚运会博物馆捐赠其中一个壁球场，另外七个壁球场”向当地社区、学校和教育机构提供球场，确保他们继续为促进这项运动做出贡献。”

;

; ;抑制排放;

;

; 绿色能源是亚运会所有比赛场馆均使用。

;

; 场馆使用的绿色电力有一部分是从青海柴达木盆地、甘肃嘉峪关、青海省柴达木盆地、甘肃嘉峪关、位于中国中北部的黄土高原。国网杭州供电公司表示，为奥运会提供的风电是在新疆维吾尔自治区等地区生产的。

;

;指电力生产过程中二氧化碳排放量极小甚至为零，与传统化石燃料发电相比，减少了对环境的影响。

;

; 第十九届亚运会场馆建设与管理部部长陈荣组委会表示，“目前奥运会绿色电力协议已达到2.2亿千瓦时，减少二氧化碳排放11.54万吨。”

;

; 杭州也一直在推广电动汽车的使用完善绿色交通体系。国网杭州供电公司竭尽全力确保所有比赛场馆均配备充电站。

;

; 该公司还为奥运会安装了国内首个大功率无线充电站。杭州萧山区亚运村的新能源汽车。该公司已建成102个充电站和2,024个充电点，为奥运会期间的绿色交通提供全面的支持服务。

;

;就连奥运会的吉祥物也展示了可持续发展的创新方法。

;

;他们的面料是采用数字印刷技术生产的，与传统方法不同，该技术不会产生任何废水、气体或纸浆。为了最大限度地减少空气污染，吉祥物是由工​​人使用电动剪刀而不是激光机剪下来的。用于生产吉祥物的电力来自于工厂屋顶的光伏装置。

;

; 此外，我们还为奥运会打造了多种环保授权产品，包括由 10 个回收瓶子制成的背包和杭州亚组委市场开发部华芳表示，“特许商品是具有特色的赛事纪念品，我们用1000克稻壳制作飞盘。”为举办首届碳中和亚运会，浙江省政府于7月11日推出了数字化管理平台。该平台使用杭州亚组委环保部门声明：利用数字技术对六城市碳排放进行监督管理，包括数据采集、核算、减排和评估等功能。

;

; 杭州亚组委环保部门的声明表示：“大型体育赛事的碳足迹涉及很多方面，包括比赛场馆建设、交通、住宿、比赛准备、观众等。

;

;”人类很难评估所有这些。有了这个平台，我们只需要输入和检查原始数据。系统自动计算碳排放量。”

;

; ;低碳倡议;

;

;同时，建立“低碳账”。该计划是为亚运村的居民设计的，包括运动员、技术官员、媒体代表和志愿者。

;

; 该计划利用阿里云的人工智能算法和双碳产品的能力，鼓励村里居民低碳生活。

;

; 居民通过在村里采取环保措施，例如回收包装和瓶子，以及避免使用塑料袋购物，为他们的账户赚取积分。这些积分可以兑换亚运纪念品，包括由低碳环保材料制成的徽章。

;

;在村外，亚运会的筹备工作帮助杭州树立了绿色生活方式的理念。< /p>;

; 自愿在社区推广垃圾分类的市民胡芳芳说，“虽然这项任务艰巨，养成良好的习惯也需要时间，但我相信在我们的共同努力下，一切都在朝着正确的方向发展。”

;

; 杭州环保志愿者孙毅说：“大家都是亚运绿色化的积极参与者。这不仅仅是鼓励他人，更重要的是在我们的日常生活中采取行动。”

;

;为了寻求更多方式实现碳中和，鼓励机构、公司和个人捐赠自己的资金。亚运会碳信用额和碳配额。

;

; 通过使用蚂蚁集团开发的移动平台蚂蚁森林，参与者可以将收集的虚拟绿色能源积分捐赠给环保活动，例如使用公共交通工具交通。

;中国取得了令人瞩目的进步一位高级政府官员在周五宣布国家双碳目标三周年纪念日之前表示，关于如何利用政策工具和市场机制实现雄心勃勃的气候目标。

;

; 2020年9月22日，习近平主席在第75届联合国大会视频一般性辩论上发表讲话时宣布，中国力争今年年底前实现碳排放峰值生态环境部应对气候变化司副司长陆新明在接受中国日报专访时表示，2060年前实现碳中和。

;

;碳强度，即每单位 GDP 的二氧化碳排放量。他说，可再生能源发电装机容量超过12亿千瓦。

;

; 今年上半年，中国可再生能源发电累计装机容量达到13.2亿千瓦，超过煤炭装机容量国家能源局称，这是中国首次发电。

;

; 这一成就是在中国实现发展和转型的艰苦背景下取得的。增长模式从资源密集型转向创新驱动——联合国秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯周三在联合国大会气候峰会上的讲话表明了保持经济增长与经济增长之间适当平衡的困难和重要性。环境保护。

;

; “从化石燃料向可再生能源的转变正在发生，但我们落后了几十年，”古特雷斯在为期一天的峰会开始时表示。 “我们必须弥补因既得利益者的拖沓、施加压力和赤裸裸的贪婪而浪费的时间，他们从化石燃料中攫取了数十亿美元。”

;

; 卢说，中国在挖掘潜力方面已取得进展。气候投资和融资作为减少碳排放的工具。 “强化政策激励，引导更多资金投向气候投融资。”

;

; 2020年10月，生态环境部会同其他四部门联合印发《指导意见》，系统部署推动气候投融资。陆说，该工具的应用。

;

; 2021 年 12 月，中国人民银行——国家中央银行——推出新的货币政策工具，通过向金融机构提供低成本贷款来支持碳减排项目。

;

; 截至 6 月底，该工具已为金融机构提供了超过 7500 亿元人民币（1030 亿美元）的支持据卢介绍，该部已帮助减少相当于超过1.5亿吨二氧化碳的温室气体排放。

;

; 为探索可行的创新气候投融资模式，该部联合其他八个政府部门在北京通州区、河南省信阳市等23个地区开展试点。

;

; 共同加大应对气候变化金融支持力度，鲁说，为推动低碳转型，工信部与国家开发银行、中国银行和中国农业银行签署了谅解备忘录。

;

; 去年，工信部协调全国各地分配了两个”某些企业披露其碳排放信息。卢说，此举预计将帮助金融机构和个人投资者准确、及时地评估他们正在进行的投资的必要性以及所实现的气候贡献。

;

; 这位官员还强调了金融机构的作用。该计划于2021年7月启动，涵盖温室气体排放量，是全球最大的碳交易计划，旨在促进气候投资和融资。

;

;电力行业涉及2000多家企业，每年排放二氧化碳超过40亿吨。

;

; 鲁说，截至8月底，电力行业碳排放配额已易手2.48亿吨。市场成交额超过115亿元。

;

; 该项目向市场发出价格信号，金融机构据此更好地管理风险、引导投资、提高资产质量和客户质量， 他说。 “目前，工信部正在组织相关研究机构共同开展碳交易试点推广到更多工业领域的专项研究。”

;

; 鲁还指出，中国重启碳交易的努力已取得明显进展。认证减排计划是一种自愿机制，允许企业通过采取促进可再生能源发电和造林等减排行动来获得碳信用额。该计划于 2017 年暂停。

;

; 卢表示，重新启动该计划所需的基础设施现已完成。 “我们的目标是最早在今年重新启动该计划，我们将加快筹备进程，确保取得具体成果，”他说。他补充道。

; Fri, 22 Sep 2023 04:52:05 +0800 001FRONT - Tiangong science lecture aired for students worldwidehttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-09/22/content_001_650ca34bed50d203d2c9cc0e.htm#001FRONT

;;

;大专院校学生周四，北京航空航天大学观看神舟十六号宇航员在天宫空间站内进行科学实验。

;

; 周四下午，神舟十六号宇航员在天宫空间站轨道上为周围的学生进行了第一次科学讲座。

;

; 在中央广播电视总台向全球直播的 48 分钟讲座的第一部分中，任务指挥官景海鹏少将、航天工程师朱扬柱上校和任务科学有效载荷专家教授桂海潮向同学们致意，并向同学们展示了梦天科学舱内的生活、工作区以及最先进的科学仪器。他们还分享了在太空中的经历。

;

; 机组人员随后进行了多项实验，以展示空间站内独特环境中的物理现象。

;

; 在一项实验中，朱和桂使用了 ping -乒乓球拍和水球显示轨道上液体表面张力的影响。在另一项实验中，两名宇航员点燃蜡烛，展示微重力环境下火焰如何形成。

;

; 宇航员邀请学生在地面上进行类似的实验，以观察在太空和太空中进行的实验之间的差异。

;

; 他们还回答了学生们提出的问题，主题包括空间碎片、失重对宇航员的影响以及大型轨道前哨站上的科学有效载荷。

;

;全国各地的学生观看了由中国载人航天工程局、教育部、科技部等政府部门主办的电视直播活动。

;

; 北京、内蒙古自治区数千名受邀学生、浙江、安徽、陕西三省在“地面类场馆”参加了讲座。

;

; 地面主会场是北京航空航天大学（原名北京航空航天大学）内的体育馆。

;

; 桂先生在被中国航天员中心选拔参加神舟十六号飞行之前，曾在该校航天学院教授航天器系统。

;

; 超过 2,400 名师生来自大学和中小学的学生参加了“地面班”

;

; “能够在太空聆听和观看这次讲座，我感到非常荣幸，这展示了我们国家的科技实力。我对蜡烛实验最感兴趣，”北航实验小学学生李柏轩说道。 “宇航员向我们展示了科学技术可以实现什么。我希望有一天能飞上太空。”

;

;北航航空航天动力学专业学生赵子仪表示，她很高兴能更多地了解梦天舱内的科学设备。

; <赵说，航天员的实验增加了她的热情，也坚定了她探索太空的决心。 “作为一名航天动力学专业的学生，​​我把航天员当作我的榜样，我会努力用我的知识报效祖国。”

;

; 此次活动是中国首个科普太空科学的天宫系列讲座的第四场。这也是神舟十五号宇航员首次在太空进行讲座。

;

; 航天员于5月30日抵达空间站，从已在空间站呆了很长时间的神舟十五号宇航员手中接过轨道前哨站。六个月。

;

; 神舟十六号宇航员的旅程是朱、桂等中国第三代航天员的首次飞行。这也是中国平民首次进入太空，桂民海成为我国第一位非军事航天员。

;

; 截至周四下午，任务指挥员敬的团队已工作了114天。在轨道上。宇航员目前状况良好。据中国载人航天工程局介绍，他们计划在空间站生活约五个月，并于11月返回地球。

;

; 迄今为止，中国航天员已为学生举办了五场太空科普讲座。中国首次此类讲座是在 2013 年 6 月神舟十号任务期间进行的。

; Fri, 22 Sep 2023 04:52:05 +0800 002PAGE TWO - HANGZHOU GOES ALL OUT TO HOST GREEN ASIAN GAMEShttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-09/22/content_002_650ca34bed50d203d2c9cc0f.htm#002PAGE TWO
;
;; ;

;

;

;徐满山，61岁，半生都在工作水利，生长在风景如画的东洲岛，位于浙江省杭州市富春江畔。

;

; 该岛曾经是江中的一个孤立的小点，只有少数人可以到达的渡口。由于交通不便，经济陷入困境。

;

; “当年，岛上家家户户都以务农为生，但要获得粮食、化肥等生活必需品，都需要乘坐小船长途跋涉。”木船，”徐说。 “人们白天出门前先听公鸡的叫声，晚上则依靠灯笼指引回家。真是麻烦。”

;

; 1976年，居民们决定在岛的两端修建两座水坝，将岛与河岸连接起来。

;

; “各位，妇女和儿童积极参与修建水坝。当时我正在上初中，一放学我就赶紧参加劳动力大军。我们肩上扛着大石头，然后把它们扔进河里。”徐说。

;

; 这些水坝通过利用富春江部分支流，封闭了近133公顷的内湖，使岛民能够开始养鱼、改造低洼地区并提高粮食产量。岛上的经济开始复苏。

;

; 修建水坝引发了徐对水利的兴趣，并进一步开发了他的家乡。

;

; 1979年，他进入大学，学的是水利，但随着时间的推移，大坝的影响逐渐显现。

;

; 首先，大坝拦住了支流北至河的水流，导致水只从南方流过。

;

; 二是生态影响明显，下游7.5公里河段形成积水，淤积恶化。

;

; 随着北至河南岸即将建设的富阳水上运动中心，在即将到来的亚运会期间举办赛艇、皮划艇等水上运动项目，杭州市政府启动了一项修复工程。河上的项目通过拆除大坝和修建水闸来解决这些问题。徐被选为该项目的负责人。

;

; 亚运会定于周六晚上在杭州开幕。

;

; “通过拆除上下游水坝并改造”死水'进入“活水”，除了疏浚12公里河道外，我们还恢复了航道的防洪能力。我们还在上下游安装了水闸、水闸，显着提高了河流的自净和通航能力。” Xu said.

;

; Dongzhou Island, which has gradually regained its ecological vitality, is providing vital support for the Asian Games.

;

; "My happiest childhood memories are of swimming in the river, catching fish and shrimp, and searching for clams. After the project was completed, I felt as though the Dongzhou Island of my cherished childhood had returned, complete with its pristine landscapes and serene waters," Xu said.

;

; Preparations for the Hangzhou Asian Games have not only transformed Xu's hometown, but also improved the environment in the city and surrounding countryside. Moreover, the commitment to "going green" has been ingrained in every aspect of constructing venues for the Games.

;

; ;Sustainable venues;

;

; Some 24,000 square meters of the roof area at the Fuyang Water Sports Centre is covered by soil and adorned with various plants, blending seamlessly with the surrounding natural landscape.

;

; The venue has a 45 percent greenery ratio and provides carbon sequestration, oxygen release and heat insulation while reducing rainwater runoff. Carbon sequestration is a natural or artificial process in which carbon dioxide is removed from the atmosphere and held in solid or liquid form

;

; Under the venue's gravel garden area, underground system recycles rainwater. After being filtered through gravel and permeable fabrics, rainwater is used for the atrium display, fountains and irrigation. This system saves some 1,000 metric tons of water per month.

;

; Only 12 of the 56 venues for the Asian Games in Hangzhou are newly built.

;

; Among them, the Shaoxing Baseball and Softball Sports Center in Shaoxing, Zhejiang province, is the largest, with a seating capacity of 10,000. Its design incorporates elements such as Shaoxing's textile heritage, traditional boats and calligraphy.

;

; The venue's interior public space is cleverly integrated with the surrounding community, creating an organic connection.

;

; In addition to the competition areas, it features a hotel, a community fitness center and commercial areas capable of meeting diverse post-event operational needs.

;

; Chen Yuewei, a publicity officer for Shaoxing, said the venue is poised to become a vital service center.

;

; Furthermore, the authorities in Shaoxing are pushing for a national-level baseball and softball youth training center to be established in the city.

;

; Meanwhile, the Shaoxing Keqiao Yangshan Sport Climbing Centre used to be the site of an abandoned mine. Construction and development work has transformed it into an international competition venue and youth sport climbing base. The center, which resembles a cocoon, features a semi-open design, allowing athletes and spectators to enjoy views of the Yangshan Scenic Area.

;

; The other 44 competition venues have either been renovated or are temporary constructions, with the emphasis placed on adopting prefabricated building techniques and using sustainable and renewable materials.

;

; For example, amenities in the Guobo Squash Hall at the Hangzhou Olympic Sports Center, such as glass walls and spectator seating, can be dismantled, allowing the venue to be reused after the Games.

;

; Zhou Congcong, director of maintenance services at the venue, said, "We are donating one of the squash courts to the Asian Games Museum, with the other seven courts being offered to local communities, schools and educational institutions, ensuring their continued contribution to promoting the sport."

;

; ;Emissions curbed;

;

; Green energy sources are being used at all the Asian Games competition venues.

;

; Some of the green electricity used at the venues is photovoltaic energy transmitted from areas such as the Qaidam Basin in Qinghai province, the Jiayu Pass in Gansu province, and the Loess Plateau in north-central China. State Grid Hangzhou Electric Power Supply Co said wind power for the Games is generated in areas such as the Xinjiang Uygur autonomous region.

;

; The term "green electricity" refers to electricity production processes with minimal to zero carbon dioxide emissions, reducing the environmental impact when compared with conventional power generated from fossil fuels.

;

; Chen Rong, director of the venue construction and management department for the 19th Asian Games Organizing Committee, said, "The green power agreement for the Games now stands at 220 million kilowatt-hours, reducing carbon dioxide emissions by 115,400 tons."

;

; Hangzhou has also been promoting the use of electric vehicles and enhancing its green transportation system. State Grid Hangzhou Electric Power Supply Co has gone to great lengths to ensure that all the Games venues are equipped with charging stations.

;

; The company has also installed China's first high-power wireless charging station for new energy vehicles at the Asian Games Village in Hangzhou's Xiaoshan district. With 102 charging stations and 2,024 charging points established, the company offers comprehensive support services for green transportation during the Games.

;

; Even the mascots for the Games showcase an innovative approach to sustainability.

;

; Their fabric was produced by using digital printing technology, which, unlike traditional methods, does not produce any waste water, gas or pulp. To minimize air pollution, the mascots are cut out by workers using electric scissors instead of laser machines. The electricity used to produce the mascots was generated from photovoltaic installations on the factory roof.

;

; Furthermore, a diverse range of eco-friendly licensed products has been created for the Games, including backpacks made from 10 recycled bottles and frisbees crafted from 1,000 grams of rice husks.

;

; Hua Fang, who works for the Hangzhou Asian Games Organizing Committee's market development department, said, "Licensed merchandise serves as distinctive event keepsakes, and we also promote the use of new concepts and technologies in product design and development."

;

; To stage the first carbon-neutral Asian Games, the authorities in Zhejiang launched a digital management platform on July 11. The platform uses digital technology to oversee management of carbon emissions in six cities, and includes functions such as data collection, accounting, emissions reduction and evaluation.

;

; A statement from the Hangzhou Asian Games Organizing Committee's environmental protection department said: "The carbon footprint of a large sporting event covers many aspects, including construction of the competition venues, transportation, accommodations, competition preparations, and spectators.

;

; "It is very difficult for humans to evaluate all this. With the platform, we only need to input and check raw data. Carbon emissions are automatically calculated by the system."

;

; ;Low-carbon initiative;

;

; Meanwhile, a "low-carbon account" program has been designed for residents of the Asian Games Village, including athletes, technical officials, media representatives and volunteers.

;

; This initiative harnesses the capabilities of Alibaba Cloud's artificial intelligence algorithms and dual carbon products to encourage low-carbon living among the village residents.

;

; Residents earn points for their accounts by adopting eco-friendly practices in the village, such as recycling packaging and bottles, as well as refraining from using plastic bags for shopping. These points can be exchanged for Asian Games memorabilia, including badges made from low-carbon, environmentally friendly materials.

;

; Outside the village, preparations for the Asian Games helped foster the concept of a green lifestyle in Hangzhou.

;

; Hu Fangfang, a resident of the city who has volunteered to promote waste sorting in her community, said, "Although this task is formidable, and developing good habits takes time, I believe that with our collective efforts, everything is moving in the right direction."

;

; Sun Yi, an environmental protection volunteer in Hangzhou, said: "Everyone is an active participant in making the Asian Games go green. It's not just about encouraging others, but more important, taking action in our daily lives."

;

; To seek more ways to achieve carbon neutrality, institutions, companies and individuals are encouraged to donate their carbon credits and carbon allowances for the Asian Games.

;

; By using Ant Forest, a mobile platform developed by Ant Group, participants can donate the virtual green energy points they collect for eco-friendly activities, such as using public transportation.

;

;

; He added that Russia is willing to maintain close coordination with China under multilateral frameworks such as the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and BRICS; resist unilateralism, hegemony and bloc-based confrontation; and safeguard international fairness and justice.

;

; Wang said that China and Russia, as permanent members of the United Nations Security Council, share an important duty in advancing world development and progress.

;

; "The two sides should strengthen multilateral strategic cooperation, safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of the two countries, and make new efforts to make the international order more just and reasonable," he said.

; Regarding the Ukraine issue, Putin reiterated Russia's willingness to resolve the crisis through dialogue and negotiation.

; Fri, 22 Sep 2023 04:52:05 +0800 003TOP NEWS - China's progress in meeting climate goals highlightedhttps://mobile.chinadaily.com.cn/cn/html5/2023-09/22/content_003_650ca356ed50d203d2c9cc14.htm#003TOP NEWS
;
;;

; China has made remarkable progress on the way to achieving its ambitious climate targets, making use of policy tools and market mechanisms, a high-ranking government official said ahead of the third anniversary of the announcement of the nation's dual carbon goal, which falls on Friday.

;

; On Sept 22, 2020, when addressing the general debate of the 75th session of the United Nations General Assembly via video link, President Xi Jinping announced that China aims to reach its carbon emission peak before the end of this decade and achieve carbon neutrality before 2060.

;

; In an exclusive interview with China Daily, Lu Xinming, deputy head for climate change at the Ministry of Ecology and Environment, said that last year, the country experienced a consistent decline in its carbon intensity, or carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP. The installed capacity of renewable power generation exceeded 1.2 billion kilowatts, he said.

;

; China's cumulative installed capacity for renewable power generation reached 1.32 billion kW in the first half of this year, exceeding that of coal-fired power for the first time, according to the National Energy Administration.

;

; Such an achievement was fulfilled against the backdrop of China's uphill battle to achieve development and, at the same time, transform its growth model from resource-intensive to innovation-driven — a difficult path that few countries have taken before.

;

; Remarks made by UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday during the UN General Assembly climate summit indicated the difficulties and the significance of maintaining the right balance between economic growth and environmental protection.

;

; "The move from fossil fuels to renewables is happening, but we are decades behind," Guterres said at the start of the one-day summit. "We must make up time lost to foot-dragging, arm-twisting and the naked greed of entrenched interests raking in billions from fossil fuels."

;

; Lu said that China has made headway in tapping the potential of climate investment and financing as a tool in reducing carbon emissions. "We have strengthened policy incentives to guide more funds toward climate investment and financing."

;

; The ministry, along with four other central government bodies, issued a guideline in October 2020, laying out systematic plans to promote the application of the tool, Lu said.

;

; In December 2021, the People's Bank of China — the nation's central bank — launched a new monetary policy instrument to support carbon reduction projects through low-cost lending to financial institutions.

;

; As of the end of June, the instrument has supported financial institutions by offering more than 750 billion yuan ($103 billion) in loans, which has helped reduce greenhouse gas emissions equivalent to over 150 million metric tons of carbon dioxide, according to Lu.

;

; In a move to explore viable and innovative models for climate investment and financing, the ministry, along with eight other government bodies, launched pilot programs in 23 areas, including Beijing's Tongzhou district and Xinyang in Henan province.

;

; In their joint endeavor to beef up financial support for tackling climate change and promoting low-carbon transition, the ministry signed memorandums of understanding with China Development Bank, Bank of China and Agricultural Bank of China, Lu said.

;

; Last year, the ministry coordinated with regions across the country to assign two series of key projects for climate investment and financing to these banks, hoping to guide them into providing preferential financial services to quality low-carbon projects, he said.

;

; In late 2021, the ministry issued a guideline that required certain enterprises to disclose information about their carbon emissions. The move is expected to help financial institutions and individual investors assess the need for the investments they are making and the climate contributions achieved in an accurate and timely manner, Lu said.

;

; The official also highlighted the role of the country's carbon trading program, which is the world's largest in terms of the quantity of greenhouse gas emissions covered, in boosting climate investment and financing.

;

; Inaugurated in July 2021, the program involves over 2,000 companies in the power sector, which annually emit over 4 billion tons of carbon dioxide.

;

; Lu said that, as of the end of August, 248 million tons of carbon emission allowances had changed hands in the market, with a turnover of more than 11.5 billion yuan.

;

; The program sends a price signal to the market, based on which financial institutions can better manage risks, guide investments and improve the quality of their assets and clients, he said. "Currently, the ministry is mobilizing relevant research institutes to jointly conduct a dedicated study on expanding the carbon trading program to more industrial sectors."

;

; Lu also pointed out the marked progress in efforts to relaunch the China Certified Emission Reduction program, a voluntary mechanism that allowed companies to earn carbon credits by taking actions to reduce emissions such as promoting renewable energy generation and afforestation.
